segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 21
segments.en: Linked Discourses 21

segments.pli: 1. Bhikkhuvagga
segments.en: 1. Monks

segments.pli: 10. Theranāmakasutta
segments.en: 10. A Mendicant Named Senior

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu theranāmako ekavihārī ceva hoti ekavihārassa ca vaṇṇavādī.
segments.en: Now at that time there was a certain mendicant named Senior. He lived alone and praised living alone.

segments.pli: So eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati eko paṭikkamati eko raho nisīdati eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
segments.en: He entered the village for alms alone, returned alone, sat in private alone, and concentrated on walking meditation alone.

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “idha, bhante, aññataro bhikkhu theranāmako ekavihārī ekavihārassa ca vaṇṇavādī”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, there’s a certain mendicant named Senior who lives alone and praises living alone.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: So the Buddha said to a certain monk,

segments.pli: “ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena theraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantehi:
segments.en: “Please, monk, in my name tell the mendicant Senior that

segments.pli: ‘satthā taṃ, āvuso thera, āmantetī’”ti.
segments.en: the teacher summons him.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yenāyasmā thero tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ theraṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to Venerable Senior and said to him,

segments.pli: “satthā taṃ, āvuso thera, āmantetī”ti.
segments.en: “Reverend Senior, the teacher summons you.”

segments.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā thero tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ theraṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, reverend,” that monk replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, thera, ekavihārī ekavihārassa ca vaṇṇavādī”ti?
segments.en: “Is it really true, Senior, that you live alone and praise living alone?”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, thera, ekavihārī ekavihārassa ca vaṇṇavādī”ti?
segments.en: “But in what way do you live alone and praise living alone?”

segments.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, bhante, eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisāmi eko paṭikkamāmi eko raho nisīdāmi eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāmi.
segments.en: “Well, sir, I enter the village for alms alone, return alone, sit in private alone, and concentrate on walking meditation alone.

segments.pli: Evaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, ekavihārī ekavihārassa ca vaṇṇavādī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how I live alone and praise living alone.”

segments.pli: “Attheso, thera, ekavihāro neso natthīti vadāmi.
segments.en: “That is a kind of living alone, I don’t deny it.

segments.pli: Api ca, thera, yathā ekavihāro vitthārena paripuṇṇo hoti
segments.en: But as to how living alone is fulfilled in detail,

segments.pli: taṃ suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho … pe ….
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” he replied.

segments.pli: “Kathañca, thera, ekavihāro vitthārena paripuṇṇo hoti.
segments.en: “And how, Senior, is living alone fulfilled in detail?

segments.pli: Idha, thera, yaṃ atītaṃ taṃ pahīnaṃ, yaṃ anāgataṃ taṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, paccuppannesu ca attabhāvapaṭilābhesu chandarāgo suppaṭivinīto.
segments.en: It’s when what’s in the past is given up, what’s in the future is relinquished, and desire and greed for present incarnations is eliminated.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, thera, ekavihāro vitthārena paripuṇṇo hotī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how living alone is fulfilled in detail.”

segments.pli: Idamavoca bhagavā.
segments.en: That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā:
segments.en: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

segments.pli: “Sabbābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
segments.en: “The sage, champion, knower of all,

segments.pli: Sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ;
segments.en: is unsullied in the midst of all things.

segments.pli: Sabbañjahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,
segments.en: He’s given up all, freed in the ending of craving:

segments.pli: Tamahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārīti brūmī”ti.
segments.en: I declare that man to be one who lives alone.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: A monk named “Senior” likes to live alone, but the Buddha questions whether it is the true solitude.
